meanings.definition: Two or more champions who share the title or honor
meanings.sent1: The two friends were named cochampions of the cooking competition.
meanings.sent2: The cochampions celebrated their victory together on stage.
meanings.sent3: The cochampions decided to split the trophy in half and share it.
meanings.sent4: In a surprising turn of events, the rivals became cochampions of the race.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cochampions promotes teamwork and collaboration in sports.

meanings.definition: To declare two or more individuals or teams as champions jointly
meanings.sent1: The judges will cochampion the two talented singers in the final round.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to cochampion both proposals for their innovative ideas.
meanings.sent3: The coach jokingly said he would cochampion the players if they tied in the game.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cochampion the teams was met with applause from the audience.
meanings.sent5: The organization aims to cochampion diversity and inclusion in all competitions.
